intro: Kesem Records is a sound design and music production studio founded by Avichai Tuchman (DoGBeaT) specialize in crafting sonic experiences that bridge the gap between technology and emotion — from retro funk to classical remixes, from electronic beats to cinematic scores.

bio.title: DoGBeaT
paragraphs: I'm Avichay Tuchman, AKA DoGBeaT — a musician who embodies the energy of '80s French disco with the raw power of rock 'n' roll. When I'm not rocking out with the folk-punk band Oy Division, you'll find me in the studio, crafting infectious melodies for TV series, theater productions, and my own solo projects.

A multi-instrumentalist and mix technician, I've spent the last decade producing and playing for a diverse range of artists — from Shlomi Shaban, Shuli Rand, Sofi Tsedaka and Shai Lahav to my duo with Noa Faran (Universal Music Group) — many of whom have become radio regulars. My passion for music transcends genre, drawing inspiration from everything that grooves and moves the soul.
I also compose for screen — scoring TV series for Kan 11 with Assaf Talmudi, and creating music for film and theater.
With a knack for blending catchy hooks with unexpected twists, my music is sure to get you moving and leave you wanting more.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
whatWeDo.text: Music production, composition, arrangement, sound design, mixing and mastering. All tracks composed, performed, and mixed in-house. Our music is available for licensing through Artlist for creators worldwide.

approach.title: Approach
approach.text: We believe in precision without sterility. Each sound is intentional, each silence meaningful. Our process combines analog warmth with digital precision, vintage character with modern clarity.
